fields.description:
I live in Australia, we run on AEST which has daylight savings time.

An issue was created by a developer on our repository on 05/10/14 at 00:24.

The Issue tracker then proceeded to state the issue was created (and updated) 'an hour ago' on 04/10/14 at 11:24.

This is obviously incorrect, the issue tracker seems to think that daylight savings started on 05/10/14 at 00:00 as opposed to it actually starting on 05/10/14 at 02:00.
fields.summary: Incorrect Issue Time w/ Daylight Savings

fields.description: I cannot create atlassian account because system not sent me confirm email. !2050714018-Screenshot%202014-10-04%2013.59.45.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: verification email not sent

fields.description:
Problem:

* PR notification hit my inbox
* Out Of Office email was sent
* The raw HTML of the OOO email was posted as a comment on the PR

It'd be good to filter these out. Also, posting the encoded HTML probably wasn't the intention in any case ;)

Screenshot attached. It was sent by MS Exchange email server, if that helps. (Yeah I know, blech, but it's what we have)
fields.summary: Don't post Out Of Office emails as PR comments (BB-11385)

fields.description:
I am reviewing some code, and some of the files won't display diffs, giving me the following error:\\
"Sorry, we can't display this file: You are not authorized to access this repository".

However, I do have access, and am able to view other files in the same review (in the same directory even).
fields.summary: You are not authorized to access this repository

* Select new repo. Result: Page with text "Your repository is empty — let's put some bits in your bucket."

which is being loaded by require-lib.js

I think the *Owner/Repository* search box must be added to the bitbucket home page.

I see it in every page I go even in the _features_ page. Why not to include it in the home  page?

If I wanna search for a repository I've to navigate to any page to do the search :(

fields.description:
The BitBucket Teams Audit Log doesn't log repository move & accept move actions.

Steps to reproduce:

# Move a repo from one team to another
# Open the audit log in the destination team
# observe that no logs pertaining to the move are present

Expected results:\\
The log shows the repo move.  What team the repo came from and who on the team initiated the move and who on the team accepted the move.
fields.summary: Audit log missing info (BB-11365)

I want to delete this repo that seems to be stuck https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/410969.\\
But I can't find how to do it.

Could you remove it for me ?

Thanks :-)

fields.description:
It would be nice if custom labels displayed with color for each issues on "issues" list.

Custom label will indicate to users, contributors and developers as: "Easy to contribute", "Announcement", or something else.
fields.summary: Add custom label feature for issues

fields.description:
Redirecting is necessary when personal repository transferring into team repository.

In this case, we need:

* redirecting old URL access to new URL (with keeping sub paths)
* keeping issues' number and entries
* keeping pull requests' number and entries

It would be very cool.
fields.summary: Allow redirecting from transferred original repository URL to new URL (BB-11353)

fields.description:
It looks like you changed something with team accounts, and now one cannot log in to Bitbucket as a team. The problem that I am facing is that "as a team" I cannot unfollow the projects now. Having multiple accounts (personal and team ones), I am receiving notification emails to a couple of emails as a result (duplication that I don't really enjoy).

Before, it all was possible, because I have some projects where my team accounts do not follow anything and I don't receive same notifications multiple times. It looks like eventually you have introduced inconsistency in the repository/account management.

Please either support some means, so the admin of the project could manage subscribers (follow/unfollow for other project members), or enable team account logins again.
fields.summary: Team account cannot unfollow the project

fields.description: I made an account and it got deactivated as soon as I made it.. Can someone activate it? Account name: farolito20
fields.summary: account deactivated

fields.description:
I'm using images in wiki, as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Add%2Bimages%2Bto%2Ba%2Bwiki%2Bpage], however problem happens when I update an image. An old one is still served. When is cache flushed?

E.g. using http://www.lambdaplugin.com/wiki/Examples.html, second image is not updated, diagnosis with curl, same url with query serves updated image:

curl -v -X HEAD https://bytebucket.org/azhdanov/lambda-plugin/wiki/Examples/time-to-resolve.png\\
...\\
Content-Length: 6191\\
ETag: "41f3cda185c0a5fe287a1f0c16e7ce0b"

curl -v -X HEAD https://bytebucket.org/azhdanov/lambda-plugin/wiki/Examples/time-to-resolve.png?1\\
...\\
Content-Length: 8377\\
ETag: "41f3cda185c0a5fe287a1f0c16e7ce0b"
fields.summary: Wiki does not show updated image (BB-11694)

fields.description:
Currently Bitbucket's Wiki doesn't seem to support any means to write part of text in a different color (this is not about code syntax coloring, but plain text). This limitation doesn't allow create good documentation where one could highlight more important terms. That would help a lot if this functionality was supported.

PS Please let me know if I am missing something, and this functionality actually exists (and how to use it then).
fields.summary: Support for colored text on Wiki

Help! Folks at Atlassian,

We are having issues with pushing to our HG repository at: [redacted]

Here is my terminal output:\\
$ hg push\\
pushing to [redacted]\\
searching for changes\\

[redacted]

Edit: Filed a proper ticket at support.atlassian:\\

fields.summary: Blocked due to waiting for lock on repository

fields.description:
It would be nice if we can add more than one language in the repository settings.

For example, right now I'm creating a project that uses C and Assembly language but I'm able to specify only one.
fields.summary: Allow us to specify more than one language in the repository settings (BB-11350)

fields.description:
Hi,

I am having problems confirming my email address. When I click the link in the email sent to me, I get the following error below:

"We were unable to confirm your email address. The validation email may have expired."

The email gets forwarded to another email address, not the email address I have linked to this account, could that be the problem?

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Cannot confirm email address

fields.description:
From our customer's issue report:

We have an 25 users account on Bitbucket: "[redacted]". A set of users has only read access to one repository "repo [redacted]", and no other rights to any other repo from our team. The read access works fine for the source code, they cannot commit. But on the private wiki they seem to have write possibilities, in contrast to the statement: "For a private wiki, a user's access to the code repository also applies to the wiki.".\\
To reproduce, login through portal with read only account on repo, goto repo, wiki, and select edit. Then change and save.
fields.summary: Wiki does not respect repository r/w permissions (BB-11343)

[facebook/remotefilelog|https://bitbucket.org/facebook/remotefilelog]

fields.description:
After I've deleted an account i've tried to create another account with the same e-mails, but it said they were already in use. The deleted account is rpedretti.

If I try to log in with that account it sais it has been deactivated an i shoud contact the support. If i try to login with the e-mails it sais that "the account is inactive".

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: E-mails cannot be used after account is deleted (BB-11345)

fields.description:
I'm using several repo related to each other (eg. one mobile app which is divided into iOS and Android, server). It would be nice if I could refer other repo's issues or commits.

For example, a github issue below contains a markup refering other repo's issue: {{pypa/pip#1586}}. maybe {{<username>/<repo name>#<issue no>}}

cf. https://github.com/poise/python/issues/98

And it would also be nice if comment hook works with the markup.
fields.summary: to refer other repo's issues or commits (BB-11346)

fields.description: It would be nice if other users could add comments to a wiki page similar to comments for commits
fields.summary: Add comments to wiki pages

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a quick option to create a clean URL that points to a directory within a repository.

So in a nutshell, by hand, I can change this:

https://bitbucket.org/colinbate/node-bitbucket-api/src/035554ff50a6b8e68ae4b14b30334162e8f8c523/lib/?at=master

to this:

https://bitbucket.org/colinbate/node-bitbucket-api/src/master/lib/

and while this does work, it would be nice to have a quick way to do this from a dropdown or a button or something, since I do this quite often.

Thanks,\\
Stephen
fields.summary: Create clean link to a directory within a repsotory (without the hash) (BB-11347)

fields.description:
hi, i see this issue reported by at least one other person, but i just created an account ( e-mail address gregorysabatino@hotmail.com ) and was immediately taken to an "your account has been disabled" page.\\
if i attempt to login ( as expected ) receive an "account disabled" message on log-in screen.\\
can you help me out?
fields.summary: account disabled upon registration

fields.description:
So, I was under the impression that you could post an attachment in a pull request comment, but apparently you can't. Is this not working or not implemented?

It would be very useful for me to post attachments in those comments, and it would be even more useful to be able to post attachments via the REST API.
fields.summary: Attaching files to pull request comments (through website and REST API)

fields.description: There should be a discount rule where reward points are awarded
fields.summary: Discount Rule for Reward Points

fields.description:
On the Overview tab of a Pull Request, sometimes it will show a comment twice, repeating a few lines of the diff as well.  I can't seem to tell what case causes this, but I've seen it more than once on different PR's.

It seems to always be the first comment, and none others that gets repeated.

eg https://bitbucket.org/nanometrics/components_helios/pull-request/69/sensors-scripts-update-recipe-for-yocto/diff\\
or see attached screen shot.
fields.summary: Comment shown twice on Pull Request

fields.description:
I recently added another email address (actually same email but with dot, gmail feature). And system is not sending verification email on it.

I don't know is that another issue but it's strongly related: I was unable to create this ticket while I had not verified email, but had a couple of verified emails.
fields.summary: Verification email not received
POST hook branch creation/deletion payload (BB-11348)

fields.description:
Hi, I am unable to access my repo. This happened all of a sudden and has been working fine for weeks. I recently tried to push my changes to the git remote repo and got the following:

*Full Error Message:*\\
fatal: unable to access 'https://pastor-fk@bitbucket.org/sportssciencems/soccerapp.git/': Received HTTP code 405 from proxy after CONNECT

I have tried git ls-remote and get the same error, and I have also tried to clone the repo into a different location.

Your advice is much appreciated.

THanks
fields.summary: Received HTTP 405 code from proxy after connect

fields.description:
I was able to clone a few days ago, but when I try to connect to the remote repository now I get a connection reset by peer.

I have tried to delete the ssh keys from my account on bitbucket and my ssh folder, and replace them with new ones but still the same problem.

Here's more information:

debug3: Incorrect RSA1 identifier\\
debug3: Could not load "/home/vahan/.ssh/id_rsa" as a RSA1 public key\\
debug1: identity file /home/vahan/.ssh/id_rsa type 1\\
debug1: identity file /home/vahan/.ssh/id_rsa-cert type -1\\
debug1: identity file /home/vahan/.ssh/id_dsa type -1\\

debug1: identity file /home/vahan/.ssh/id_ecdsa type -1\\

debug1: identity file /home/vahan/.ssh/id_ed25519 type -1\\

fields.description: Currently the default wiki view is the "Home" page, which is not configurable.  However, some users would like the ability to have the list of wiki pages be the default view.
fields.summary: Option to make list of wiki pages default wiki view (BB-11296)

fields.description: To achieve better user experience in new feature of bitbucket on pull requests. label tag should be added to checkbox's of tasks.
fields.summary: label tag in tasks to achieve better UX (BB-11337)

fields.description:
It would be _*totally awesome*_ if Bitbucket had support for hooks to [Amazon SNS|http://aws.amazon.com/sns/].

If you were still accepting [new brokers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Write%2Bbrokers%2B%2528hooks%2529%2Bfor%2BBitbucket] then I'd write one :)

In my use case, I work with a number of systems (Bamboo, JIRA, etc.) behind a corporate firewall, but policy prevents these servers from being exposed to the internet to receive external hooks. The workaround we have at the moment is a bit of a kludge :-/
fields.summary: Amazon SNS hooks

fields.description:
I just signed up for a new account. However, upon responding to the confirmation email, a message appears that says, "We were unable to confirm your email address. The validation email may have expired."

A quick search suggested this: You should be about to go back to your list of email addresses (Account > Email addresses) and click 'resend confirmation' for the email address in question.

However, when I go to Email Addresses, there is no "Resend Confirmation" link. What should I do?
fields.summary: Problem Confirming email

fields.description:
Atlasian-Ticket: CA-50662

Project: https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/bitbucketorg/

Team: https://www.transifex.com/organization/atlassian/team/10845/members/de/

Me: https://www.transifex.com/accounts/profile/BrainInBlack/

LastUpdate: 09/21/2012

Currently it is impossible to make progress on the German Translation of Bitbucket, because the administrative Team for it is definitely inactive. There are contributors that translate strings on a regular basis, but no one that is approving, proof reading and so on.

Also, already approved strings are most of the times incorrect, do not follow consistency, false wording and so on. In other words, it's a mess.
fields.summary: Transifex German Translation Team Inoperable (BB-11336)

fields.description:

https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/bitbucketorg/language/zh_CN/

* Reorder the files in a more logical order

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I believe I've found a bug in the "side-by-side diff view".\\
see\\
https://bitbucket.org/jeffr/side-by-side-ff/commits/d0d469164fba05b93c7a93c6c892210e73606a31\\
The basic view shows the files correctly, however the side-by-side diff\\
view loses track of the line numbering at the formfeed on line 5 and\\
everything after that is misnumbered and lines with changes are doubled\\
probably as a result of the misnumbering.
fields.summary: side-by-side diff mishandles formfeeds (BB-11295)

fields.description:
I am running Firefox 32 on Ubuntu and an 'x' button to remove a linked account is not showing up.

The 'x' button does however show up for me on Chrome version 35.0.1916.153
fields.summary: No 'x' button to remove linked account (BB-11331)

fields.description:
In a project home folder I have two files: readme.rst and readme.md; readme.md is a symlink to readme.rst.

Before the latest BitBucket upgrade an Overview page was rendering a readme.rst just fine, but now it doesn't and only shows a file name.  I suspect that during an upgrade BitBucket only looks for readme.md.  However, this works well in Github and in the previous version of BitBucket it worked well too.

Could you fix this ?

A possible solution would be to implement this enhancement:\\
https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/5558/handle-symbolic-link-to-readmes-bb-6765
fields.summary: An Overview page does not render a README.rst (BB-11330)

fields.description:
Hi All, I've just logged on to BitBucket and find my dashboard entirely empty.\\
Last week it contained a couple of projects: a shared tutorial one, a test one and another that I was sharing with the company Roundhouse - all seem to have vanished?\\
Any ideas?\\
Paul
fields.summary: Dashboard Empty
Make scroll bar always visible on pull request page (BB-11329)

fields.description:
It would be useful to have endpoint that will list every group that user has created or is a member of.

Also you might want to update documentation regarding this endpoint:

* endpoint: GET https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/groups/{accountname}
* doc page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/groups+Endpoint#groupsEndpoint-GETalistofgroups

Part "_The caller must authenticate with administrative rights on the account or as a group member to view a group_", seems misleading since it made me believe I would get all the groups I am a member of.

Have a good day!
fields.summary: API endpoint for listing all the groups that user belongs to (BB-11328)

fields.description: My repository is only 35MB but I cant seem to push it to bitbucket without getting the error "POST git-receive-pack (chunked)". Does anybody have a solution for this?
fields.summary: Getting error POST git-receive-pack (chunked)

fields.description:
*New issue message* on issue tracker settings has a WYSIWYG editor but the message is rendered out as plain text (read: markdown is not processed)

!531738431-issue-message-wysiwyg.png|thumbnail!

h2. How to reproduce
# Go to the repo's issue tracker settings
# Enter a markdown message in the *New issue message* editor.
# Save
# Create a new issue on the same repo

h2. Actual result
The message is rendered in plain text.

!1654552680-issue-message-rendered.png|thumbnail!

h2. Expected result
The message should be processed by markdown and be rendered with the appropriate HTML.

If the message is not intended to be markdown enabled, then shouldn't the editor be just a textarea instead of a WYSIWYG?
fields.summary: Markdown rendering support for new "New issue message" (BB-11327)

fields.description: Hi... i would like to activate my account again... jpvacarezza@gmail.com

fields.description:
Hi!

Sometimes (I haven't found out in exactly which cases, but it seems random), API will not update branch information right away (https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/{account}/{repo}/branches) when push happens. It seems that the info is updated with delay of about 10 minutes.

At the office we have a local install of Packagist which tracks our GIT repos on our BitBucket account (both public and private). Hooks fire correctly and Packagist does it's job correctly, but it receives stale data from the API, thus not updating info on the package.

Is this a known issue? How can I work around it? It's annoying having to wait to be able to use composer after pushing.
fields.summary: Delay updating in BitBucket API v1.0 (BB-11326)

fields.description:
It seems impossible to log in to BitBucket the first time with a GitHub account.  Doing so will result in an error: "It looks like you tried to sign up with another service. Unfortunately you can no longer sign up using your GitHub account. You can create an account below, or  sign up with a Google account."

According to the documentation here, GitHub support doesn't appear to have been removed: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Bitbucket+wants+a+password+but+I+login+with+an+account+from+another+service

If this is expected behavior, it seems that there should be some clarifying text on the log-in page (explaining that you must first create a BitBucket account, then connect your GitHub account to it).
fields.summary: Can't Log In with GitHub Account

What do you think guys, would be good If something like this could be integrated into Bitbucket. I can't imagine pull requests without this userscript because PR on bitbucket are very limited in this (managing many PR is painful, you have to recheck PR everytime).

fields.description:
When processing a pull request that has been merged offline our logic\\
to find the merge commit boils down to: can we find a commit that is the\\
merge of the source branch head and destination branch head? For this we check the children of the source branch head as the merge candidates.

Unfortunately, we previously only checked the parents of the merge\\
candidates for the destination branch head, meaning that if you both merged a pull\\
request offline and advanced the destination branch, e.g.,

{code}
Before push:

  2  <-- foo, src_head
 /
1    <-- master, dest_head

After push:

4    <-- master (and what should be merge_commit)
|\
3 |
| |
| 2  <-- foo, src_head
|/
1    <-- dest_head
{code}

we would not record the merge commit (4) since the previous destination branch head\\
(1) is not a child of the merge commit (but it is an ancestor).

Another scenario where we won't detect the merge commit is

{code:text}
3    <-- master, dest_head 
| 2  <-- foo, src_head
|/
1

5    <-- master (and what should be merge_commit)
| \
| 4  <-- foo
| |
3 |  <-- dest_head
| |
| 2  <-- src_head
|/
1
{code}

Here the {{src_head}} has advanced (from 2 to 4) in the same push that it is merged. We currently don't check if the {{src_head}} has been advanced and so the merge candidates we look at are the children of 2 rather than the children of 4.
fields.summary: Improve calculation of merge commit in pull requests when merged offline (BB-11249)

Thanks for your consideration.

fields.description:
Happens in Mercurial (hg) repos.

Several months ago pull requests were automatically marked as merged if the corresponding merge happened in the repo.

Now the autoclose does not happen, and after a manual merge, the pull request remains open but displays 0 files changed. After that, I have to either hit Merge and have an extra pair of commits, or hit Decline which is not what's intended.

Sorry if I created a duplicate. I could not find any related issues.
fields.summary: Pull request does not close automatically after having merged locally via hg (BB-11321)

fields.description: Right now, the results of a git mv in a commit are shown in bitbucket as if the previous file was removed and a new file was added. However, it's important that the commit display show that a git mv operation happened, because git mv preserves line-by-line annotations whereas a cp / git rm / git add does not. Further, cosmetically, this clutters up the diff by potentially hundreds or thousands of lines that could be boiled down into a single line.
fields.summary: Please create a better display for git mv (BB-11223)

fields.description:
At the moment when adding a members to a group, you can add with an email address or a username.

Ideally we would like you to be able to add other groups.

Use case:

Devs:\\
bob\\
sam

Testers:\\
joe\\
liz

All:\\
<Testers>\\
<Devs>

We have a lot of repos and quite a lot of users, we would like to be able to manage meta groups to allow some repos to easily have essentially global read permissions to our users, but also have some fine grained groups. I don't want to have to add a new member of staff to lots of individual groups.
fields.summary: Ability to add a group to another group (BB-11222)
